group_1.textRight: But, but, how can we raise money for the Festival...?

group_1.textLeft: I haven't come up with anything concrete yet,@either...
But, funds aside...
We also need to change everyone's fundamental@approach to the Fire Festival...

group_1.textRight: Huh, huh, what does that mean...?

group_1.textLeft: Miyu, do you understand what the Fire Festival is?

group_1.textRight: It is... a festival to honor the god of@Hikarizuka Shrine!

group_1.textLeft: So, you think there is a god?

group_1.textRight: Eh?
Well... Yeah...
I can't see it with my eyes, but there are times@when I think it might be there.

group_1.textLeft: What kind of times are those...?

group_1.textRight: Silly question, siiilly question!@During the Fire Festival, of course!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103101:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!

group_1.textRight: That split second when the Youth Association@members boldly dive into the blazing flames...
And invite out the Sacred Vessel...
The vigor and the fervor were sooo powerful...
...that I feel as if the god is right there!

group_1.textLeft: It's the same for me...!

group_1.textRight: You too, Lady San?!

group_1.textLeft: Everyone's passion for the Fire Festival is@awakening the god of Hikarizuka.
That's the feeling I get...!

group_1.textRight: Yes, Lady San!

group_1.textLeft: But you see, the people who criticise the Festival@don't understand this.

group_1.textRight: Whaaat?!
But, if they just come to the Festival, even once,@they'll understand this...

group_1.textLeft: No, I'm sure they wouldn't understand@even if they saw it.
I think their fundamental approach to the@Fire Festival...
Their faith in gods... has been so diminished...
That they see the Festival as nothing more@than a dangerous event.

group_1.textRight: Oh no, oh nooo!
That means the criticism of the Festival will@NEVER go away...!

group_1.textLeft: Well...@There's got to be a way.

group_1.textRight: What is it...?!

group_1.textLeft: They don't believe in gods, so they condemn the@Festival as dangerous...
Then, for example...@if we could bring a visible god here...
And make them believe in it...
Then perhaps everyone would realize the meaning@of the Fire Festival, and we could keep it going...
...Just kidding.

group_1.textRight: Amazing, Lady San! Nice plan!@That's an excellent idea!

group_1.textLeft: Hold on, Miyu, I was just joking...

group_1.textRight: Eh, is that so?
It sounds like such a good idea that Miyu thought@it was the only way to go...

group_1.textLeft: I mean, things like bringing gods here are just@impossible, no matter what...
Instead, we'll have to figure out a more realistic@method.
For the time being, we must solve the fundraising@problem...
Ah...

group_1.textRight: I had no clue you were in such a place.
It's 'bout time you get back to the@Community Center.
Without the two of you, the preparations for the@Festival won't get underway.

group_1.textLeft: Sorry, Big Bro Tatsu.@I'm going back.

group_1.textRight: Alright.
You do a little work, and I'll serve you some@"Baby Moon" for a snack.

group_1.textLeft: I told you, I'm not a kid now.@I'm not eating that anymore.

group_1.textRight: [chara:801100:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What? You used to love it so much you'd eat it@to the point of getting a stomach ache!

group_1.textLeft: Oh COME ON, you don't have to tell me that@every time...!
...But, thanks...

group_1.textCenter: Gosh...@So quick to treat me like a child...
